quotations.quote: Wonder is the foundation of all philosophy. Inquiry the beginning, ignorance the end.
I should prefer uneloquent good sense to loquacious folly.
Providence shows no mercy to weak nations, but recognizes the right of existence-only of sound and strong nations.
If the only significant history of human thought were to be written, it would have to be history of its successive regrets and impotences.

Where is the life we have lost living? 
 Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge?
 Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
